name: BaryteDemo
subtitle: Oil Drilling & Industrial Applications
description: Baryte is a naturally occurring mineral composed of barium sulfate (BaSO₄), known for its high specific gravity, chemical inertness, and whiteness. It is widely used as a weighting agent in oil & gas drilling fluids and in paints, plastics, rubber, and filler applications.
grades: Drilling Grade – High density, low silica
meshSizes: Custom mesh sizes available on request

name: Calcium Carbonate
subtitle: Industrial & Construction Grade
description: Calcium Carbonate is a versatile industrial mineral widely used in construction, plastics, paper, paints, and rubber industries. It offers high purity, excellent whiteness, and controlled particle size for consistent industrial performance.

name: Phospho Gypsum
subtitle: Cement & Agriculture Applications
description: Phospho Gypsum is a by-product of phosphoric acid manufacturing, primarily composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate (CaSO₄·2H₂O). It is widely used in cement production, agriculture, and construction materials.

name: Quartz Silica Sand
subtitle: Glass, Foundry & High-Tech Industries
description: Quartz Silica Sand is a high-purity silica derived from naturally occurring quartz stone. It is a key raw material for glass, foundry, construction, and high-tech industries such as semiconductors and photovoltaics.

name: Silica Fume (Microsilica)
subtitle: High-Performance Concrete Additive
description: Silica Fume is an ultra-fine pozzolanic material obtained as a by-product of silicon alloy production. With particle size less than 1 micron, it significantly enhances concrete strength, durability, and chemical resistance.

name: Fly Ash
subtitle: Pozzolanic Cement Material
description: Fly Ash is a fine powdery by-product from coal combustion in thermal power plants. Rich in silica and alumina, it improves concrete strength, workability, and durability while reducing environmental impact.

name: Bentonite
subtitle: Drilling & Industrial Clay
description: Bentonite is a natural clay rich in montmorillonite, known for its excellent swelling, binding, and absorbent properties. It is widely used in drilling, foundry casting, construction, and waterproofing applications.
meshSizes: Custom mesh sizes available on request
